item.title: MSSQL | Potatos and how to not use them
item.description: Note: Before you dive in, I want to point out that this post does not explore deep, low-level technical details. It’s a proof of concept for an alternative technique that I haven’t seen anyone else cover, so I decided to write about it. I don’t think it will provide major benefits, but it might be useful for some red team engagements, especially when using Living off the Land and it is a fun technique.

I am a cybersecurity professional specializing in red team operations, internal penetration testing, and Active Directory exploitation.

Currently, I work on red team engagements and security assessments involving modern enterprise environments, focusing on Active Directory security, ADCS exploitation, SCCM security assessments, and Exchange server compromises. Currently holding following certifications:

  • HTB Certified Active Directory Pentesting Expert (CAPE)
  • Certified Red Team Operator (CRTO)
  • Certified Red Team Master (CRTM)
  • Certified Red Team Expert (CRTE)
  • Certified Red Team Professional (CRTP)
  • Certified Red Team Specialist v2 (CRTS)
  • Certified Red Team Analyst v2 (CRTA)
  • Practical Network Penetration Tester (PNPT)
  • Certified Active Directory Pentesting eXpert v2 (C-ADPenX)
  • Certified Red Teamer (CRTeamer)
  • Certified Enterprise Security Professional (CESP-ADCS)
  • Certified Active Directory Red Team Specialist (AD-RTS)

Feel free to connect
